dc_description_s: This layer is a georeferenced raster image of the historic paper map entitled: Projection gï¿½ï¿½o-sphï¿½ï¿½rique ou Plan trigonographique de la France : contenant tous les lieux devenus cï¿½ï¿½lï¿½ï¿½bres dans l'Astronomie par le grand nombre d'observations cï¿½ï¿½lestes qu'y ont ï¿½ï¿½tï¿½ï¿½ faites depuis l'ï¿½ï¿½tablissement de l'Acadï¿½ï¿½mie R. des Sciences et tous ceux dont la longitude et la latitude se concluent des opï¿½ï¿½rations gï¿½ï¿½omï¿½ï¿½triques, entreprises dï¿½ï¿½s le commencement de ce Siï¿½ï¿½cle par ordre de Sa Majestï¿½ï¿½ pour dï¿½ï¿½terminer la figure de la Terre, dressï¿½ï¿½e pour l'utilitï¿½ï¿½ des gï¿½ï¿½ographes et des navigateurs par Mr. Rizzi Zannoni de l'Acad? Roy? de Sc? et Belles Lettres de Gottingue. It was published by Donnï¿½ï¿½e au public et dirigï¿½ï¿½e par Desnos, Rue S. Jacques, au Globe in 1763. Scale approximately 1:3,100,000. Map in French. The image inside the map neatline is georeferenced to the surface of the earth and fit to the Europe Lambert Conformal Conic coordinate system. All map collar and inset information is also available as part of the raster image, including any inset maps, profiles, statistical tables, directories, text, illustrations, index maps, legends, or other information associated with the principal map. This map shows features such as drainage, cities and other human settlements, territorial and administrative boundaries, shoreline features, and more. Includes also ornamental cartouche decorated with coat of arms of France and surveying tools; "Remarques"; bar scales.This layer is part of a selection of digitally scanned and georeferenced historic maps from the Harvard Map Collection. These maps typically portray both natural and manmade features. The selection represents a range of originators, ground condition dates, scales, and map purposes.
